qas.question: What type of furnace was functional in China in 722 BC?
What element was used in the production of wrought iron?
What type of iron could pig iron be converted into?
What type of process was used to convert various metals into steel?
What can iron ore be converted into in a blast furnace?

context: Evidence suggests that <a0_0>blast<a0_0/> furnaces, that convert raw iron ore into <a4_0>pig iron<a4_0/>, which can be remelted in a cupola furnace to produce cast iron by means of a cold blast and hot blast, were operational in China by the late Spring and Autumn period (722–481 BC). The bloomery was nonexistent in ancient China; however, the Han-era Chinese produced wrought iron by injecting excess <a1_0>oxygen<a1_0/> into a furnace and causing decarburization. Cast iron and pig iron could be converted into <a2_0>wrought<a2_0/> iron and steel using a <a3_0>fining<a3_0/> process.
